page.title: 19CHICKENS
page.content: At{Bleasby Moor,}but actually in Lissington parish, there are two large sheds, 260 by 40 feet, in which some 135,000 hens are kept on the battery system,that is,they are kept in wire cages just large enough for one hen,stacked several cages high in closely packed rows,with just enough room for a man to walk between the rows. The hens are fed and watered automatically. They consume about 100 tons of food per week, containing both imported and locally grown grain. The hens produce about 2,000 cases of eggs per week,each case containing 30 eggs. These are sold to a wholesaler, who sells them mainly in the London area.
